intro: Silene paghmanica, commonly known as the Paghman's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and showy pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Silene paghmanica is a perennial species that blooms during the summer months, contributing to the floral diversity of its native habitat.
